newsitem.title: USA: Former American Express chair may launch fund - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Former American Express chair may launch fund - WSJ.

text.p: A former chairman of the American Express financial services empire who resigned under pressure three years ago is believed to have talked with an investment firm about launching a private equity fund in the new year, The Wall Street Journal reported Tuesday.
James Robinson III has been quietly testing the waters for a fund of perhaps $200 million, the story says.
He has extracted early commitments from some former American Express associates who have not always seen eye to eye with him, the story says.
